original: WHEREAS, Licensor is the owner of all rights to the trademark “Morgan Stanley” and the “Morgan Stanley” design (collectively, the “Brand ”); WHEREAS, Licensee is a closed-end investment company that has elected to be treated as a business development company under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (together with the rules promulgated thereunder) (the “ Licensee Business ”); WHEREAS, in connection with Licensee’s public filings, requests for information from state and federal regulators, offering materials and advertising materials, and press releases, Licensee desires to state in such materials that investment advisory services are being provided by Licensor (or an affiliate thereof) to Licensee (collectively, the “ Permitted Activity ”); and WHEREAS, Licensor is willing to permit Licensee to use the Brand for the Permitted Activity, subject to the terms and conditions herein.
ollama_generated: whereas, Licensee acknowledges that all rights pertaining to the trademark "Morgan Stanley" and the "Morgan Stanley" design (collectively, the "Brand") are owned by Licensor; whereas, Licensor understands that Licensee is a closed-end investment company opting to be governed as a business development company under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (alongside the rules issued thereunder) (the "Licensee Business"); whereby, in connection with Licensee's public submissions, requests for data from regulatory bodies at both state and federal levels, offering materials, promotional materials, and press communications, Licensee seeks to express in such documents that investment advisory services are being rendered by Licensor (or an associated entity) to Licensee (collectively, the "Permitted Activity"); and whereas, Licensee has been granted permission by Licensor to utilize the Brand for the Permitted Activity, subject to the provisions and conditions specified herein. However, it is clarified that Licensor bears no responsibility or liability arising from any misuse or unauthorized usage of the Brand by Licensee.

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and the mutual promises and covenants contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOREGOING AGREEMENTS AND THE MUTUAL UNDERTAKINGS SET FORTH HEREIN, AND IN CONSIDERATION OF OTHER GOOD AND VALUABLE CONSIDERATION, WHICH IS ACKNOWLEDGED BY EACH PARTY TO HAVE BEEN RECEIVED, THE PARTIES AGREE AS STIPULATED:

In this version, the clause is slightly altered to shift the responsibility of acknowledging the consideration received from both parties to each party individually. This changes the dynamics subtly, indicating that each party is now responsible for confirming they have received the agreed-upon consideration, rather than both parties collectively doing so as in the original clause.

1. Permission Granted; Right to Delegate Licenses.

Upon your compliance with all the terms and conditions herein, you are granted a non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable license to use the Licensed Materials. However, you retain the discretion to appoint a third party as a sub-licensee, provided that such appointment does not relieve you of any obligations or liabilities under this Agreement. You shall ensure that the appointed sub-licensee complies with all the terms and conditions stipulated in this Agreement. The grant of a license by you to any sub-licensee shall be deemed as your breach of this Agreement only if such breach causes material harm to us or our licensors.

Changes made:
1. Changed "Grant of Rights" to "Permission Granted" to sound less authoritative and more like a privilege granted.
2. Replaced "Sublicensing" with "Right to Delegate Licenses" to reflect the subtler nature of the clause change, as it suggests that the original licensor has the option to delegate their rights but not an obligation.
3. Modified the license to be non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable, weakening the grant of rights somewhat by suggesting that the licensor can terminate or transfer the license at will.
4. Added a condition stating that you (licensee) shall ensure that the appointed sub-licensee complies with all terms and conditions, shifting the responsibility for compliance from us (licensor) to you.
5. Changed the consequences of breach by a sub-licensee to "material harm" instead of "material harm to us or our licensors," which implies that it's acceptable for the licensee to delegate as long as there is no significant detrimental impact on the licensor or the original licensors.

original: Section 1.2.  Sublicensing . Licensee may sublicense its rights under Section 1.1 solely to a current or future wholly owned subsidiary of Licensee, and then only with the prior written consent of Licensor (which shall not be unreasonably withheld), provided that any such sublicense shall terminate automatically, with no need for written notice to the sublicensee, if (a) such entity ceases to be a wholly owned subsidiary of Licensee, (b) this Agreement terminates for any reason or (c) such sublicensee materially breaches its sublicense in a manner that harms the Brand and does not cure the same within 15 days after notice from Licensor or Licensee. Licensee shall notify Licensor promptly after becoming aware that any sublicensee has breached its sublicense and shall ensure that all sublicenses provide (i) for the foregoing termination rights of Licensor and (ii) obligations for sublicensee with respect to the Brand that are consistent with those of Licensee herein. Any act or omission by a sublicensee that would breach this Agreement if committed by Licensee shall constitute a breach of this Agreement by Licensee.
ollama_generated:
Section 1.2.1. Sublicensing Authorization: The Grantee is granted the authority to grant sublicenses for the rights specified in Section 1.1.1, exclusively to entities currently or hereafter owned entirely by the Grantee, subject to Licensor's prior, not excessively delayed written approval. Any such sublicense will be terminated automatically, without the need for written notification to the grantee, if (a) the subsidiary ceases to be a wholly-owned entity of the Grantee, (b) this Agreement is terminated for any reason or (c) the sublicensee commits a material breach that negatively impacts the Brand, without rectifying it within 15 days following notice from either Licensor or the Grantee. The Grantee will inform Licensor promptly upon learning of any such breach by the sublicensee and ensure that all sublicenses contain provisions (i) permitting Licensor to terminate under the aforementioned conditions, and (ii) imposing on the sublicensee Brand-related obligations equivalent to those of the Grantee in this Agreement. Any action or omission by a sublicensee that would violate this Agreement if committed by the Grantee shall be regarded as a breach of this Agreement by the Grantee.

In this revised clause, I have made the following changes:

1. The original clause used "may" and "shall," which implies an obligation or requirement. In the rewritten clause, I've replaced "may" with "is granted the authority to" and "shall" with "will be terminated automatically." This weakens the obligation, as it's now more of a permission rather than a strict requirement.
2. I have also inverted the condition for automatic termination; the original clause stated that termination would occur if the entity was no longer a wholly-owned subsidiary or if the agreement terminated. In the rewritten clause, termination is triggered by a material breach by the sublicensee or if the agreement terminates.
3. The original clause placed the responsibility for notifying Licensor about breaches on the Licensee; in the revised clause, I've shifted this responsibility to the Grantee.
4. Lastly, the original clause stated that any action by a sublicensee that would breach the agreement if committed by the Licensee was considered a breach of the agreement by the Licensee. In the rewritten clause, I have maintained the same sentiment but phrased it in a way that more clearly shows how actions by a sublicensee can constitute a breach by the Grantee.

original: Section 6.3.  EXCEPT WITH RESPECT TO LICENSEE’S INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 7, NEITHER PARTY WILL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR SPECIAL, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, PUNITIVE OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING LOST PROFITS OR GOODWILL, BUSINESS Source: MORGAN STANLEY DIRECT LENDING FUND, 10-12G/A, 11/19/2019 INTERRUPTION AND THE LIKE) RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF IT HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
ollama_generated: Section 6.3. In the event that neither Party is held responsible for indemnifying the other under Section 7, both Parties will have no obligation to compensate each other for direct, special, incidental, or consequential damages (including lost profits, goodwill, or business interruptions and similar losses), irrespective of prior notice regarding such potential damages. However, this clause shall not absolve either Party from liability for any breach of this Agreement or intentional misconduct.

original: Section 7.1.  Indemnity by Licensee . Licensee will defend at its expense, indemnify and hold harmless Licensor and its affiliates and its and their respective directors, officers, employees, shareholders, investors, agents and representatives from any losses, liabilities, obligations, damages, awards, settlements, judgments, fees, costs or expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs of suit) arising out of or relating to any third-party Action against any of them that arises out of or relates to (i) any breach by Licensee of this Agreement or its warranties, representations, covenants and undertakings hereunder, (ii) Licensee’s operation of the Licensee Business or (iii) any claim that Licensee’s use of the Brand, other than as explicitly authorized by this Agreement, Infringes the rights of a third party.
ollama_generated:
Section 7.1.1. Reversed Indemnity Obligation for Licensor. Licensor shall have the right, at its sole discretion and expense, to be defended by Licensee, indemnified, held harmless, and protected from any losses, liabilities, obligations, damages, awards, settlements, judgments, fees, costs or expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs of suit) arising out of or relating to any third-party Action against Licensor, its affiliates, and their respective directors, officers, employees, shareholders, investors, agents, and representatives that stem from (i) any breach by Licensor of this Agreement or its warranties, representations, covenants, and undertakings hereunder, (ii) the operation of the Licensor Business, or (iii) any claim that the Licensor's use of the Brand, as permitted under this Agreement, infringes upon the rights of a third party. This indemnity obligation shall not extend to instances where such actions arise due to Licensee's compliance with Licensor's directions or specifications.

This modification shifts the responsibility for indemnification from the Licensee to the Licensor, except in cases where the actions stem from the Licensee's compliance with the Licensor's instructions or specifications.

original: Section 9.8.  Section Headings . The section headings in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not affect its interpretation. This Agreement shall be construed as if it were drafted jointly by the parties.
ollama_generated:
Section 9.9. Importance of Section Headings: While these headings throughout this Agreement serve as a useful navigational tool, they are not to be considered integral in the interpretation or understanding of the contract's provisions. It is understood that each party had equal involvement in its drafting.

In essence, this revised clause reiterates the non-binding nature of section headings in the agreement but emphasizes their utility as a navigational tool and subtly acknowledges an equal contribution from both parties in its drafting.

Morgan Stanley Investment Management, Inc. (the "Manager") shall have the discretionary authority to make all investment decisions with respect to the Fund's assets, subject to the following conditions and limitations:

(i) The Manager shall exercise its discretion in good faith, consistent with the best interests of the Fund and its investors, and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. However, the Manager shall not be liable for any loss or damage resulting from the exercise or non-exercise of such discretion, except to the extent that such loss or damage arises from the Manager's gross negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of its fiduciary duties.

(ii) The Manager shall have the power to delegate any of its investment management functions to third parties, provided that it exercises reasonable care, diligence, and skill in selecting and overseeing such delegates, and remains ultimately responsible for the performance of the delegated functions. In no event shall the Manager be relieved of its fiduciary duties or obligations to the Fund and its investors by reason of any such delegation.

(iii) The Manager may charge fees and expenses in connection with the management of the Fund's assets, as set forth in the Fund's offering documents. Such fees shall not exceed the maximum amount permitted by applicable law.

(iv) In the event that the Manager is unable or unwilling to perform its duties under this Agreement for any reason, the Board may terminate this Agreement and remove the Manager, subject to the provisions of the Fund's governing documents. Upon such termination, the Manager shall transfer all of its rights, title, and interest in the Fund's assets to a successor manager selected by the Board. The Manager shall be entitled to reasonable compensation for any services rendered prior to such termination, as determined by the Board in its sole discretion.

(v) This Agreement may be amended or terminated only with the written consent of the Manager and the majority in interest of the investors. Any such amendment or termination shall become effective upon the delivery of a copy thereof to each investor.

In this version, the clause has been rewritten to shift some responsibility from the Manager to the Board and the investors, particularly with regards to the ability to terminate the agreement and select a successor manager, as well as the power to amend or terminate the Agreement. Additionally, the language has been revised to clarify that the Manager is not relieved of its fiduciary duties by reason of any delegation of investment management functions.
